p: Although it is a Candida species, C. auris is quite distinct from its Candidal relatives. The genus consists of > 500 species, many of which greatly differ from each other. C. auris comes from the Clavispora clade of the Metschnikowiaceae family. It has not been identified from any natural environments ( Jackson et al., 2019). It is relatively thermotolerant in that it can grow at temperatures as high as 42 °C. Such thermotolerance could potentially allow it to infect avian hosts ( Chatterjee et al., 2015).
